title: After creating a file and modifying it for 2 times, I'm not able to open the file again (Cache related?)
body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
rclone v1.39-122-g6546b7e0β

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
debian (3.16.0-4-amd64)

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
see below

> A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
see below


I think I found a bug related to cache.

With these stepts I'm able to reproduce the issue:

1. on mount, create file with nano. e.g. nano testfile
2. type something in, save the file an close
3. edit file again with e.g. nano testfile
4. again type something in, save and close
5. try to open file again e.g. nano testfile

Error:
testfile: Zu viele offene Dateien im System

Debug:

> 2018/02/06 11:17:27 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.39-122-g6546b7e0β" starting with parameters ["rclone" "mount" "gdrive_decrypted:" "/mnt/.union" "-vv" "--allow-other" "--uid=1000" "--gid=1000" "--umask=007" "--cache-tmp-upload-path=/mnt/.local/.cache" "--cache-tmp-wait-time=24h"]
